author: Contributing Editor
title: LA Assessor Ushers in New Era of Technology
text:
The L.A. County Assessor‚Äôs Office Thursday ushered in a new digital era with the launch of a cloud-based platform that will replace what the office called 40 years of outdated technology.
Assessor Jeff Prang and county Supervisor Lindsey Horvath ‚Äúflipped the switch‚Äù on the system, marking a symbolic change for the county. The new system will be used for the 2025 Assessment Roll and bolster public access to property information, according to the office.
Previously, the county‚Äôs 2.4 million real property assessments were maintained in paper files and microfiche that had to be processed manually. Information requests had to be researched by hand, which the assessor‚Äôs office described as a ‚Äúslow‚Äù and ‚Äúall-consuming‚Äù process, requiring an in-person visit to one of its six district offices.
The effort, known as the Assessor‚Äôs Modernization Project, was completed in partnership with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, moving more than 40 years of paper-based filing to the cloud-based system.
Using the technology, county residents can access the Assessor Portal to easily search for property information online. The public portal provides a more user-friendly search engine for a larger field of data for all property parcels compared to the previous system, according to Prang‚Äôs office.
Users can access data on a desktop computer or a mobile device. Maps and other digital systems will also allow users to see the property or parcel of land they are searching for. County residents can conduct and complete transactions online, sign documents electronically, and if they have questions, they can get help from the AI Assessor Chatbot, according to the office.
The Assessor‚Äôs Office rolled out the cloud-based system over time to avoid major pitfalls that are likely to happen under what is known as a ‚ÄúBig Bang‚Äù approach, where technology is launched all at once and can lead to failures and cost overruns, officials said.
For county staff, when they use the cloud-based system, each step requires a supervisor‚Äôs review and check before moving on to the next level, which officials tout as ensuring a more secure process.

author: Mike Duffy,Natalia Escalante
title: How you can enjoy winter fun in metro Detroit this weekend
text: DETROIT (WXYZ) ‚Äî The holiday season might be over, but there‚Äôs still time to enjoy winter fun. It's the final weekend for the Downtown Detroit Markets and Monroe Street Midway. Cirque du Soleil and the Fire and Ice Festival return to Detroit. Here are seven things to do in the D: - Thursday and Friday 7:30 p.m., Saturday 3 p.m. and 7 p.m. and Sunday 1 p.m. and 5 p.m. - Little Caesars Arena at 2645 Woodward Avenue in Detroit - Cirque du Soleil returns to Detroit this weekend with its ‚ÄúCrystal‚Äù show. Circus act performers will hit the ice during this special production at Little Caesars Arena. - Thursday 11 a.m. to 8 p.m., Friday and Saturday 11 a.m. to 11 p.m. and Sunday 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. - Cadillac Square at 662 Woodward Avenue in Detroit - The Downtown Detroit Markets are open in Cadillac Square through this weekend. They open Daily at 11 and stay open until 8pm on Wednesday and Thursday and until 11pm Friday and Saturday. Dozens of vendors are selling apparel, home goods, food and even pet accessories. - Friday 4 p.m. to 9 p.m., Saturday noon to 8 p.m. and Sunday noon to 6 p.m. - Robert C. Valade Park at 2670 Atwater Street in Detroit - The Fire and Ice Festival returns to Valade Park. You‚Äôll experience medieval fun with a winter twist that includes oversized fires, an ice carving competition and, of course, turkey legs. Elsa from "Frozen" and Renaissance Fair performers will also make appearances. - Thursday and Friday 4 p.m. to 8 p.m. and Saturday and Sunday noon to 8 p.m. - Five locations around downtown Detroit - You can hop on a festive trolley that makes stops around the holiday magic in downtown Detroit. The Holly Trolley makes five stops ‚Äî the Book Tower, Capitol Park, Campus Martius Park, Parker‚Äôs Alley and Columbia Street. The trolley runs about every 15 minutes and is a great way to explore town for free through Sunday. - Thursday 11 a.m. to 8 p.m., Friday and Saturday 11 a.m. to 10 p.m. and Sunday 11 a.m. to 8 p.m. - Monroe Street Midway at 22 Monroe Street in Detroit - You can enjoy winter games at the Monroe Street Midway. From an arctic slide to bumper cars to an arcade, it‚Äôs a great place to take the family. You have until Sunday to take in the fun. - Main Street in downtown Rochester - Every night 5 p.m. to midnight - If you haven‚Äôt seen The Big, Bright Light Show in Rochester, you still have a couple more weeks to get a visit in. More than 1 million lights downtown will be beaming out holiday cheer through Jan. 21. You can also visit art galleries, shops and restaurants. [The Rink at Campus Martius Park](https://downtowndetroit.org/experience-downtown/things-to-do/the-rink/) - Thursday 11 a.m. to 9 p.m., Friday 11 a.m. to 11 p.m., Saturday 10 a.m. to 11 p.m. and Sunday noon to 8 p.m. - Campus Martius Park at 800 Woodward Avenue in Detroit - Sitting right in the heart of downtown Detroit is The Rink at Campus Martius Park. Ice skating is open until March 3. Related: [Monroe Street Midway returning with winter activities starting Nov. 9](https://www.wxyz.com/news/monroe-street-midway-returning-with-winter-activities-starting-nov-9) [Festive trolley offering free rides to 5 stops throughout Downtown Detroit](https://www.wxyz.com/news/festive-trolley-offering-free-rides-to-5-stops-throughout-downtown-detroit) [Lights are now on in Rochester as families, businesses celebrate the Big, Bright Light Show](https://www.wxyz.com/news/region/oakland-county/lights-are-now-on-in-rochester-as-families-businesses-celebrate-the-big-bright-light-show) Are you hosting an event next weekend? Email us about it at [webteam@wxyz.com](mailto:webteam@wxyz.com).

author: AFP
title: X et les journaux: hier l'amour fou, demain le divorce? - 15/11/2024 √† 14:42 - Boursorama
text:
Le r√©seau social X d'Elon Musk est devenu pour certains d'entre eux un "cauchemar informationnel": trois grands journaux viennent de le quitter en l'accusant de propager la d√©sinformation. ( AFP / Nicolas TUCAT )
Vu comme un eldorado par les m√©dias quand il s'appelait Twitter, le r√©seau social X d'Elon Musk est devenu pour certains d'entre eux un "cauchemar informationnel": trois grands journaux viennent de le quitter en l'accusant de propager la d√©sinformation.
Le quotidien britannique The Guardian a annonc√© mercredi qu'il ne publierait plus de contenus sur cette "plateforme m√©diatique toxique". Il a √©t√© suivi jeudi par le journal espagnol La Vanguardia puis vendredi par le Su√©dois Dagens Nyheter.
Pr√©lude, peut-√™tre, √† d'autres d√©parts? La question s'√©tait d√©j√† pos√©e en 2022, quand Musk avait rachet√© Twitter. Il l'avait rebaptis√© X et y a drastiquement r√©duit la mod√©ration, au nom de la libert√© d'expression.
Apr√®s l'√©lection de Donald Trump √† la pr√©sidence am√©ricaine, avec le soutien actif de Musk, "on peut s'attendre √† ce que d'autres √©diteurs de presse quittent X", dit √† l'AFP Stephen Barnard, chercheur √† l'universit√© am√©ricaine Butler.
Mais "leur nombre d√©pendra probablement des actions de X, Musk et l'administration Trump √† l'√©gard des m√©dias", nuance-t-il. "S'ils sont aussi hostiles envers eux qu'ils l'ont √©t√© par le pass√©, cela entra√Ænera vraisemblablement d'autres d√©parts".
Adversaire revendiqu√© des m√©dias, lui-m√™me accus√© de favoriser la d√©sinformation, Musk a √©t√© nomm√© par Trump √† la t√™te d'une nouvelle commission charg√©e de tailler dans la d√©pense publique.
- D√©pendance -
Elon Musk soutient Donald Trump pendant la campagne pr√©sidentielle am√©ricaine, le 27 octobre 2024 au Madison square garden √† New-york ( AFP / ANGELA WEISS )
Pour justifier son d√©part de X, le Guardian a estim√© que "les avantages" d'y √™tre √©taient d√©sormais surpass√©s "par les inconv√©nients", notamment l'omnipr√©sence de "th√©ories du complot d'extr√™me droite et du racisme".
A l'inverse, √† son d√©collage en 2008-2009, Twitter √©tait vu par les m√©dias comme l'endroit o√π il fallait absolument √™tre, pour avoir un contact direct avec les lecteurs et les sources d'information, experts comme politiques.
Les m√©dias "y ont trouv√© et √©largi un public, construit des marques, d√©velopp√© de nouvelles pratiques journalistiques, form√© une communaut√©", ce qui a en retour "notablement renforc√© l'influence de Twitter", √©num√®re M. Barnard.
Au point de s'enfermer dans une d√©pendance que les m√©dias payent aujourd'hui? "Je le pense, oui", r√©pond √† l'AFP Mathew Ingram, ancien sp√©cialiste des m√©dias num√©riques √† la revue am√©ricaine Columbia Journalism Review.
"De nombreux √©diteurs de presse ont abandonn√© toute forme d'interaction avec leurs lecteurs en l'externalisant vers les r√©seaux sociaux comme Twitter, et de ce point de vue-l√†, ils r√©coltent ce qu'ils ont sem√©", d√©veloppe-t-il.
Apr√®s la fi√®vre des d√©buts, et avant m√™me l'av√®nement de Musk, des voix critiques s'√©taient d'ailleurs √©lev√©es. Elles pointaient le m√©canisme du r√©seau, qui encourage pol√©miques et indignations instantan√©es, et le reflet d√©form√© qu'il offre de la soci√©t√©, puisque CSP+ et militants y sont surrepr√©sent√©s.
- Quelles alternatives? - Reste √† savoir si quitter X est pr√©judiciable aux journaux, d√©j√† frapp√©s par une grave crise √©conomique.
"Nous allons probablement perdre des abonnements, parce que certains lecteurs s'abonnent apr√®s avoir vu une nouvelle sur le r√©seau social", a pr√©dit Jordi Juan, le directeur de La Vanguardia, aupr√®s de l'AFP.
Une hypoth√®se temp√©r√©e par M. Barnard: "Il est peu probable que cela ait un effet significatif sur les revenus des m√©dias, car X g√©n√®re relativement peu de trafic vers les sites d'information par rapport √† d'autres plateformes".
En octobre 2023, six mois apr√®s que la radio publique am√©ricaine NPR e√ªt quitt√© Twitter, un rapport de la Fondation Nieman pour le journalisme jugeait les effets de ce d√©part "n√©gligeables" en termes de trafic.
Autre question: quitter X, mais pour aller o√π?
Certains internautes pr√¥nent un d√©part vers un autre r√©seau social am√©ricain, Bluesky. Celui-ci a annonc√© vendredi avoir enregistr√© un million de nouveaux utilisateurs en une journ√©e.
Mais ses 16 millions d'inscrits p√®sent encore peu face aux utilisateurs actifs de X, estim√©s √† plusieurs centaines de millions.
"Des alternatives strictes √† ce que propose X, il n'y en a pas aujourd'hui. Mais il va peut-√™tre falloir les inventer", d√©clare √† l'AFP Vincent Berthier, responsable du d√©partement technologies √† RSF (Reporters sans fronti√®res).
Pour l'ONG fran√ßaise de d√©fense de la presse, le fait que les journaux quittent X est "le sympt√¥me de l'√©chec des d√©mocraties √† r√©guler les plateformes" internet, quelles qu'elles soient.
"Musk, c'est le visage radical de ce cauchemar informationnel qu'il y a sur les plateformes, mais le probl√®me est beaucoup plus global", insiste M. Berthier.

author: @EjeCentral
title: ¬øQui√©n era Nelsy Cruz? Gobernadora de Monte Cristi que muri√≥ tras el colapso del techo de la discoteca Jet Se
text:
¬øQui√©n era Nelsy Cruz? Gobernadora de Monte Cristi que muri√≥ tras el colapso del techo de la discoteca Jet Set en Rep√∫blica Dominicana
Una tragedia sacudi√≥ Santo Domingo: el colapso del techo de la discoteca Jet Set, durante un concierto del cantante de merengue Rubby P√©rez, dej√≥ 120 muertos
Lo que parec√≠a una noche de fiesta en la discoteca Jet Set, ubicada en Santo Domingo, Rep√∫blica Dominicana, termin√≥ en tragedia tras el colapso del techo del establecimiento durante un concierto del cantante Rubby P√©rez. Entre las v√≠ctimas mortales se confirm√≥ la muerte de la gobernadora de Monte Cristi, Nelsy Cruz.
Las autoridades municipales de Santo Domingo confirmaron que, entre las m√°s de 120 personas fallecidas en el lugar, se encontraba la funcionaria, hermana de un exjugador de b√©isbol.
Lee | Colapso de techo de la discoteca Jet Ser deja m√°s de 100 muertos en Rep√∫blica Dominicana
¬øQui√©n era Nelsy Cruz?
Nelsy Milagros Cruz Mart√≠nez era gobernadora de Monte Cristi desde agosto de 2020, designada por el presidente de la Rep√∫blica Dominicana, Luis Abinader.
Integrante del Partido Revolucionario Moderno (PRM), estaba a cargo de la coordinaci√≥n de programas sociales, seguridad ciudadana y gesti√≥n institucional en la provincia.
Nelsy era hermana del jugador profesional de b√©isbol Nelson Cruz, quien jug√≥ durante 19 temporadas en las Grandes Ligas. Fue √©l quien confirm√≥ el fallecimiento de su hermana a trav√©s de un comunicado en Instagram:
‚ÄúCon profundo dolor, la familia Cruz Mart√≠nez comunica el fallecimiento de nuestra querida hermana, madre, hija y amiga: Nelsy M. Cruz Mart√≠nez‚Äù.
¬øQu√© pas√≥ en la discoteca Jet Set?
La Procuradur√≠a General de la Rep√∫blica inform√≥ que se abri√≥ una investigaci√≥n penal para determinar las causas del colapso.
De acuerdo con cifras oficiales, hasta el momento se registran 113 personas fallecidas y m√°s de 255 heridas, debido al accidente ocurrido durante la presentaci√≥n art√≠stica del cantante de merengue Rubby P√©rez.
At 12:34 a.m. Tuesday, April 8, 2025 the roof of the Jet Set Nightclub, Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic collapsed.
‚Äî ùìùùì≤ùì¥ùì¥ùì≤ (@PFKHealth)
At least 113 people were killed and another 155 injured including Nelsy Cruz, governor of the Monte Cristi province and former MLB players, Octavio Dotel and Tony‚Ä¶[https://t.co/ZuQvb6ylG3][pic.twitter.com/CnxMxU7s9T][April 9, 2025]
Los hechos se registraron cerca de la 1:00 de la madrugada, aproximadamente una hora despu√©s de iniciado el concierto, cuando se desplom√≥ el techo del establecimiento.
El Centro de Operaciones de Emergencias (COE) indic√≥ que contin√∫an las labores de rescate y que a√∫n se investigan las causas del colapso en la discoteca Jet Set, uno de los locales m√°s concurridos del ambiente nocturno de Santo Domingo.
Luto nacional
El presidente Luis Abinader declar√≥ tres d√≠as de duelo nacional mediante un decreto que ordena izar las banderas a media asta en los edificios oficiales.
Esta medida fue anunciada como un gesto de solidaridad con las v√≠ctimas del siniestro, ocurrido en una estructura que, seg√∫n se inform√≥, no hab√≠a sido inspeccionada recientemente.
Por su parte, el Ministerio de Salud P√∫blica activ√≥ protocolos de emergencia en los principales hospitales de Santo Domingo y habilit√≥ unidades m√≥viles de atenci√≥n m√©dica en las inmediaciones de la discoteca.
AM3

author: MENAFN
title: Vystar Credit Union And Orange County Head Start Honored With Prestigious Sargent Shriver Award By Florida Head Start Association
text: Forgot Username or Password Date (MENAFN- PR Newswire) VyStar Credit Union Logo (PRNewsfoto/VyStar Credit Union) JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Nov. 7, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- VyStar Credit Union is proud to announce that it has been awarded the prestigious Sargent Shriver Excellence in Community Service Award by the Florida Head Start Association (FHSA) in recognition of its outstanding partnership with Orange County Head Start. This award, one of Head Start's most esteemed honors, celebrates the credit union's significant contributions to ensuring inclusivity and accessibility by fostering a sense of unity and shared responsibility for promoting financial education as part of a successful collaboration that has flourished over the past eight years. "We are incredibly proud of the work we've done in partnership with Orange County Head Start," said VyStar@Work Business Development Leader Steve Martin. "This award is not just a recognition of our efforts but a celebration of everyone who has supported this initiative along the way. Our work together has changed the lives of countless individuals in our community, and we are excited to continue this impactful journey." The Sargent Shriver Award is named in honor of Sargent Shriver, a pivotal figure in the creation and development of the Head Start program. As a key architect of the War on Poverty, Shriver envisioned Head Start as a comprehensive child development program aimed at helping disadvantaged preschool children achieve their full potential. This award not only recognizes the success of the VyStar and Orange County Head Start partnership at the state level but also advances the nomination to the Regional level with the Region IV Head Start Association. VyStar and Orange County Head Start have worked tirelessly to create innovative programs and opportunities that have far exceeded initial expectations, making a lasting difference in the lives of employees of Orange County Head Start and over 3,200 participating families over the past three years alone. This collaboration exemplifies the true spirit of community service and dedication to "Heart Work," as it is fondly referred to by Orange County Head Start. "We are thrilled to recognize VyStar Credit Union's remarkable contributions and the difference they've made in our communities," said Program Manager, Orange County Head Start Florida Sandra Ruff. "They have made it their mission to reach as many individuals as possible and provide them with the tools they need to make informed financial decisions. Their partnership with Orange County Head Start embodies the values that Sargent Shriver envisioned, and we are excited to celebrate this milestone with them." In addition to the Sargent Shriver Award, VyStar's efforts have garnered three additional nominations for state awards from Orange County Head Start, further highlighting the success of this powerful collaboration. To celebrate this achievement and honor VyStar's continued commitment to communities within the credit union's footprint, the FHSA will host the 2024 Annual Awards Luncheon during its 25th Anniversary Conference. The event is scheduled for December 11, 2024, at The DoubleTree by Hilton at the Entrance to Universal Orlando. About VyStar Credit Union VyStar Credit Union is the second-largest credit union headquartered in Florida, with over 79 branches and is now 1,000,000 members with assets of over $14 billion. VyStar is the top mortgage lender in Northeast Florida and a major employer in the region with over 2,200 employees across the communities it serves. VyStar membership is open to everyone who lives or works in the 49 contiguous counties of Central to North Florida, 29 Georgia counties, and past and present military members and their families all over the world. For more information, visit vystarcu , and follow us on Facebook , Instagram , X (Twitter), and LinkedIn . SOURCE VyStar Credit Union MENAFN07112024003732001241ID1108863336 Legal Disclaimer: MENAFN provides the information ‚Äúas is‚Äù without warranty of any kind. We do not accept any responsibility or liability for the accuracy, content, images, videos, licenses, completeness, legality, or reliability of the information contained in this article. If you have any complaints or copyright issues related to this article, kindly contact the provider above. Tags Comments Category

author: Luca Mastinu
title: Incidente mortale in galleria a Urbino tra pullman e ambulanza, parla un testimone: "Sono stati pochi secondi"
text: Incidente mortale in galleria a Urbino tra pullman e ambulanza, parla un testimone: "Sono stati pochi secondi" Un accompagnatore che viaggiava a bordo del pullman che si √® scontrato con l'ambulanza in galleria ad Urbino racconta l'incidente Pubblicato il: Nella galleria Ca‚Äô Gulino di Urbino ancora riecheggia il boato del violento impatto tra pullman e ambulanza che nel pomeriggio di mercoled√¨ 27 dicembre si sono scontrati, con il mezzo di soccorso che ha preso fuoco e i quattro occupanti della Croce Rossa che hanno perso la vita. ‚ÄòIl Resto del Carlino‚Äô ha raccolto la testimonianza di un accompagnatore che viaggiava a bordo dell‚Äôautobus insieme alla scolaresca. [Incidente a Urbino, parla un testimone](#iol-toc-878c99314a42a24a9677e6e4e4cef9b2) [Cos'√® successo nella galleria](#iol-toc-e6002ae60910ac5afc8bb65845975fb3) [Come stanno gli occupanti del pullman](#iol-toc-da43bee25157db70d111025816e81ff3) Incidente a Urbino, parla un testimone A poco pi√π di 24 ore dal terribile incidente, ‚ÄòIl Resto del Carlino‚Äô ha potuto raccogliere la testimonianza di Stefano Ruggeri, accompagnatore che viaggiava proprio sul pullman che si √® scontrato con l‚Äôambulanza. A bordo dell‚Äôautobus della ditta Canalibus di Monteprandone viaggiavano 47 persone tra bambini di 8 anni e adolescenti di 15, quattro seminaristi, altri maggiorenni, il parroco don Roberto Traini e l‚Äôautista Massimo Mariotti di 51 anni. Un testimone racconta il terribile incidente avvenuto in una galleria a Urbino tra un pullman e un‚Äôambulanza: ‚ÄúSi √® trattato di pochi secondi‚Äù Poche parole ma forti abbastanza, quelle usate da Stefano Ruggeri per raccontare l‚Äôaccaduto. L‚Äôaccompagnatore racconta che tutto si √® svolto in una manciata di secondi. Le sue parole: ‚ÄúIl pullman era appena ripartito dal parcheggio quindi i ragazzi erano tutti svegli e attivi‚Äù. Poi la tragedia: ‚ÄúL‚Äôautista ha cercato di avvertire il conducente dell‚Äôambulanza lampeggiando con gli abbaglianti, ma √® stata una frazione di secondi‚Äù. Subito dopo l‚Äôimpatto, tutti i presenti si sono accertati che nessuno si fosse ferito gravemente, dopodich√© l‚Äôautista ha ordinato di abbandonare il pullman. Cos‚Äô√® successo nella galleria Nelle ore immediatamente successive all‚Äôincidente mortale, il sindaco di Urbino Maurizio Gambini [ha ipotizzato](https://notizie.virgilio.it/il-video-del-sindaco-di-urbino-dopo-lo-scontro-tra-pullman-e-ambulanza-in-galleria-forse-dovuto-a-sorpasso-1599673) che a causare la tragedia potrebbe essere stato un sorpasso. Ipotesi pi√π o meno confermata da ‚ÄòOpen‚Äô, che riporta che l‚Äôambulanza potrebbe aver invaso la corsia sulla quale viaggiava l‚Äôautobus. L‚Äôimpatto sarebbe avvenuto tra il lato sinistro del mezzo di soccorso e quello destro del mezzo sul quale viaggiavano i ragazzi. Come stanno gli occupanti del pullman Come racconta l‚Äôaccompagnatore Stefano Ruggeri, solo l‚Äôautista e un seminarista che viaggiava nei posti davanti hanno accusato conseguenze pi√π importanti dopo l‚Äôimpatto, ma nessuno degli occupanti dell‚Äôautobus ha richiesto interventi sanitari di emergenza. Al contrario, Ruggeri racconta che i ragazzi ‚Äúhanno subito assunto atteggiamenti da adulti‚Äù, dunque non si sarebbe creata alcuna situazione di panico nonostante il fumo e nonostante l‚Äôevidente pericolo dovuto alle fiamme.

author: Laura Ferguson
title: Sleet and snow weather warning for Greater Glasgow as more flooding expected this weekend - Glasgow Live
text: A [weather](https://www.glasgowlive.co.uk/all-about/weather) warning for snow and rain is in place across parts of the Greater Glasgow area for tomorrow. The yellow alert issued by the Met Office comes into effect at 8am on Saturday, December 30 and will remain in place throughout the entirety of the day, coming to an end at 11.59pm that night. The warning is in place for the majority of Scotland, including Renfrewshire and Dunbartonshire. Forecasters have warned that "a period of sleet and snow, turning to rain, will bring some disruption during Saturday." People in affected areas have been warned to prepare for some [travel disruption](https://www.glasgowlive.co.uk/all-about/traffic-and-travel). READ MORE: [Last days of 2023 ‚Äòunsettled‚Äô weather says Met Office with ‚Äòcolder-than-average‚Äô January on the way](https://www.glasgowlive.co.uk/news/last-days-2023-unsettled-weather-28361284) READ MORE: [Huge Glasgow Central Station queues as passengers travelling to London stuck due to cancellations](https://www.glasgowlive.co.uk/news/glasgow-news/huge-glasgow-central-station-queues-28360206) It comes after Storm Gerrit battered the country, leading to [widespread chaos across roads and railways](https://www.glasgowlive.co.uk/news/storm-gerrit-glasgow-drivers-warned-28355259) on Wednesday, December 27, with the aftermath of the storm continuing well into Thursday. The Met Office warning reads: "An active frontal system will extend northeastwards through Saturday bringing heavy rain to low levels and a period of snow across higher ground to some parts of Scotland. Snow accumulations are expected largely above 250-300 metres, where 5 to 10 cm may accumulate. "At lower levels mostly rain is expected with 15-25 mm, although some snow accumulations may occur for a time over northwestern areas, with perhaps 1 to 3 cm in places. Snow turning to rain in the south early afternoon and melting snow over high ground along with some heavy rain and saturated ground may lead to some flooding of roads and railways. Rain and snow clearing from the south through the afternoon and evening." Join [Glasgow Live's Whatsapp Community here](https://chat.whatsapp.com/JwtiZHMMHYYCVZ8KrjAISB) and get the latest news sent straight to your messages.
